column4: x-server is messed up and i can't load up gnome after i upgraded
Can someone help me out with this thread?
the command is sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
i tried that, but it said that x-server-xorg is not installed
that's because the package is xserver-xorg, not x-server-xorg
you must type the EXACT command for it to work
ok. i started the reconfiguration of xserver-xorg
how do i know which video card driver i supposed to select?
well what video card do you have?
what cmd do i use to check?
Is there a command that I can type so I can find out what video card I have?
i went through the configuration of xserver-xorg, but that didn't help
rebooted, and went into normal mode - Said that the xserver failed to load
it said that i needed to restart the GDM
